I'm having trouble with the "Wharf" part's interior (ignore Val dying in the background lol)

 

Everyone is there - but the interior is black... thoughts?

15 minutes ago, Saybur Stuff said:

I'm having trouble with the "Wharf" part's interior (ignore Val dying in the background lol)

 

Everyone is there - but the interior is black... thoughts? 

The iva's are bundled in an 'extras' folder that comes with the download. 

Make sure you have enough RAM

Edited July 28 by modus

19 minutes ago, modus said:

The iva's are bundled in an 'extras' folder that comes with the download. 

Make sure you have enough RAM

On 11/21/2023 at 11:40 AM, nmaletto said:

I am having an issue with the biggest centrifuge . It works normally except the science lab. It researches, but when I attempt to transmit the science it acts like it was transmitting but doesn't actually send the science. Every other lab and part works normally. I checked the logs and saw the following:

Exception handling event onPartActionUICreate in class ModuleScienceLab:System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at ModuleScienceLab.updateModuleUI () [0x00000] in <4b449f2841f84227adfaad3149c8fdba>:0 
  at ModuleScienceLab.onPartActionUI (Part p) [0x00025] in <4b449f2841f84227adfaad3149c8fdba>:0 
  at EventData`1[T].Fire (T data) [0x000b0] in <4b449f2841f84227adfaad3149c8fdba>:0

Spoiler

Bit late, but I just ran into and fixed this issue myself. Fortunately, the method from this post worked - I found the SSPXR-TACLS-01.cfg file (in GameData/StationPartsExpansionRedux/Patches), and made a backup. Then, I found the relevant Centrifuges section (starts at line 138) and changed 

@MODULE[TacGenericConverter],*
	{
		@conversionRate *= #$/MODULE[ModuleDeployableCentrifuge]/DeployedCrewCapacity$
		@conversionRate += 0.2
	}

into 

	!MODULE[TacGenericConverter],*
	{	}

The Cronus worked as expected after that.
The mod just isn't installing on Mac- none of the parts seem to show up. Anyone have any idea what's going on with it?

20 minutes ago, MacintoshKSP said:

The mod just isn't installing on Mac- none of the parts seem to show up. Anyone have any idea what's going on with it?

 

Well, I have a Mac, and it works fine. Three things I can think of -1. You used CKAN, but as far as I know, it is different here on Macs, and is much odder to use. But you do say "CKAN is my sworn enemy", so..... 2. You downloaded it incorrectly. It must in Gamedata  as StationPartsExpansionRedux. 3. You do not have all dependencies.  You also need Near Future Props, B9PartSwitch, and ModuleManager. They must all be in the Gamedata folder. But not the one they came with when downloaded.

2 hours ago, Mr. Kerbin said:

Well, I have a Mac, and it works fine. Three things I can think of -1. You used CKAN, but as far as I know, it is different here on Macs, and is much odder to use. But you do say "CKAN is my sworn enemy", so..... 2. You downloaded it incorrectly. It must in Gamedata  as StationPartsExpansionRedux. 3. You do not have all dependencies.  You also need Near Future Props, B9PartSwitch, and ModuleManager. They must all be in the Gamedata folder. But not the one they came with when downloaded.

So, do I separately download NFP, B9PS, and MM and replace the ones /in/ the folder with the updated ones? And, do I take the StationPartsExpansionRedux file out of it's unzipped GameData file and place the IVAs in the SPEX file as well?

43 minutes ago, MacintoshKSP said:

So, do I separately download NFP, B9PS, and MM and replace the ones /in/ the folder with the updated ones?

No. You can use the ones already there. Simply put them in the stock Gamedata Folder too. You can find a way to download  MM by-itself somewhere on the forum, if you want to, as the current packaged version is outdated, current MM version is 4.2.3 I believe. You don't have to though. As for B9PS and NFP, just use the ones in zip file. Also make sure you don't have two MM's. If you do, use the one with a number closer to 4.2.3.

50 minutes ago, MacintoshKSP said:

And, do I take the StationPartsExpansionRedux file out of it's unzipped GameData file and place the IVAs in the SPEX file as well?

Yes, take it out of the unzipped Gamedata. A good rule of thumb is to never have 2 Gamedata's. Place the IVAs into the stock, prebuilt GameData file. Don't put them into the SPEX file.

2 minutes ago, Mr. Kerbin said:

No. You can use the ones already there. Simply put them in the stock Gamedata Folder too. You can find a way to download  MM by-itself somewhere on the forum, if you want to, as the current packaged version is outdated, current MM version is 4.2.3 I believe. You don't have to though. As for B9PS and NFP, just use the ones in zip file. Also make sure you don't have two MM's. If you do, use the one with a number closer to 4.2.3.

Yes, take it out of the unzipped Gamedata. A good rule of thumb is to never have 2 Gamedata's. Place the IVAs into the stock, prebuilt GameData file. Don't put them into the SPEX file.

I just downloaded this mod. Im noticing some of the parts have some kind of a see through/transparent look to them.  Not all of them, but some.     Has anyone else had this issue before? or know what the cause may be?

37 minutes ago, HammerTyme said:

I just downloaded this mod. Im noticing some of the parts have some kind of a see through/transparent look to them.  Not all of them, but some.     Has anyone else had this issue before? or know what the cause may be? 

If it's mainly centrifuge parts, this is a known issue with FreeIva and JSI Advanced Transparent pods.  I'd suggest removing the latter.

On 8/4/2024 at 5:03 PM, JonnyOThan said:

If it's mainly centrifuge parts, this is a known issue with FreeIva and JSI Advanced Transparent pods.  I'd suggest removing the latter.

I discovered the issue. It was Magpie mods.  Which is unfortunate because I really like Magpie mods as it gives parts a very nice shiny realistic looking texture to them. But only on stock parts. So other modded parts will make them have some kind of weird transparent issue.  Bummer.

5 hours ago, HammerTyme said:

I discovered the issue. It was Magpie mods.  Which is unfortunate because I really like Magpie mods as it gives parts a very nice shiny realistic looking texture to them. But only on stock parts. So other modded parts will make them have some kind of weird transparent issue.  Bummer. 

Are you using deferred?

On 8/6/2024 at 4:41 AM, JonnyOThan said:

Are you using deferred?

I am, yes.

33 minutes ago, HammerTyme said:

I am, yes. 

Haven't tested this myself but it appears another user identified a fix for compatibility issues between Deferred and Magpie.
